work.name: Pure Storage
work.description: Creating a data platform and enabling a more effective and efficient data science
work.summary: Develop a data platform and LLM-based enablements for the company's data science and analytics teams.
highlights: Created Octillion Signature Maker, an Autogen-based API (initially prototyped as a ChatGPT 'custom GPT') that uses LLM to generate regexes and JSON output within a tightly constrained system.

Drafted a data literacy curriculum aimed at onboarding new hires onto the democratized data platforms.

Architect and implement a Jupyter-based pipeline for porting twenty years' worth of data from a MS Access database to a longitudinal REDCap project.
Dispatch dataset generation, curation, and analysis requests supporting the lab's grant applications and underpinning 10+ published papers.
Develop new or implement existing logic for feature extraction from raw behavioral data.
Debug, develop, and otherwise maintain Scalable Informatics for Biomedical Imaging Studies (SIBIS), a Python-based platform for uniform processing and data sharing of clinical neuroimaging datasets.
Track any changes in Git and SVN and document functionality in a MediaWiki instance.
Worked with a team of RAs to organize and QC datasets. Mentored interns and new team members.

projects.name: Cover Letter Automation
projects.description: An AutoGen-based multi-agent (extractor-writer-critic) conversational setup for generating cover letter drafts
highlights: Write a self-improving set of cover letter drafts based on JSON resume and job description inputs
Create a set of 'unit-test-like' DeepEval evals for each LLM element of the system to ensure functionality and scalability
Make the system pluggable into any pipeline that can accept JSON input and output
Test locally-run open-source LLMs and commercial APIs for performance and accuracy in generating cover letters
If you're reading a cover letter from me, odds are that this system probably generated the first couple of drafts of it
